intro: Paracarphalea pervilleana, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads. Paracarphalea pervilleana is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
